intro: Cephalostigma paniculatum, commonly known as the panicled cephalostigma, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, clustered flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a velvety texture. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
